Browse the source code of codebrowser/source/externals/clhep/include/CLHEP/Geometry/BasicVector3D.h

1// -*- C++ -*-
2// ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
3//
4// This file is a part of the CLHEP - a Class Library for High Energy Physics.
5//
6// History:
7// 12.06.01 E.Chernyaev - CLHEP-1.7: initial version
8// 14.03.03 E.Chernyaev - CLHEP-1.9: template version
9//
10
11#ifndef BASIC_VECTOR3D_H
12#define BASIC_VECTOR3D_H
13
14#include <iosfwd>
15#include "CLHEP/Vector/ThreeVector.h"
16
17namespace HepGeom {
18 /**
19 * Base class for Point3D<T>, Vector3D<T> and Normal3D<T>.
20 * It defines only common functionality for those classes and
21 * should not be used as separate class.
22 *
23 * @author Evgeni Chernyaev <Evgueni.Tcherniaev@cern.ch>
24 * @ingroup geometry
25 */
26 template<class T> class BasicVector3D {
27 protected:
28 T v_[3];
29
30 /**
31 * Default constructor.
32 * It is protected - this class should not be instantiated directly.
33 */
34 BasicVector3D() { v_[0] = 0; v_[1] = 0; v_[2] = 0; }
35
36 public:
37 /**
38 * Safe indexing of the coordinates when using with matrices, arrays, etc.
39 */
40 enum {
41 X = 0, /**< index for x-component */
42 Y = 1, /**< index for y-component */
43 Z = 2, /**< index for z-component */
44 NUM_COORDINATES = 3, /**< number of components */
45 SIZE = NUM_COORDINATES /**< number of components */
46 };
47
48 /**
49 * Constructor from three numbers. */
50 BasicVector3D(T x1, T y1, T z1) { v_[0] = x1; v_[1] = y1; v_[2] = z1; }
51
52 /**
53 * Copy constructor.
54 * Note: BasicVector3D<double> has constructors
55 * from BasicVector3D<double> (provided by compiler) and
56 * from BasicVector3D<float> (defined in this file);
57 * BasicVector3D<float> has only the last one.
58 */
59 BasicVector3D(const BasicVector3D<float> & v) {
60 v_[0] = v.x(); v_[1] = v.y(); v_[2] = v.z();
61 }
62
63 /**
64 * Destructor. */
65 virtual ~BasicVector3D() {}
66
67 // -------------------------
68 // Interface to "good old C"
69 // -------------------------
70
71 /**
72 * Conversion (cast) to ordinary array. */
73 operator T * () { return v_; }
74
75 /**
76 * Conversion (cast) to ordinary const array. */
77 operator const T * () const { return v_; }
78
79 /**
80 * Conversion (cast) to CLHEP::Hep3Vector.
81 * This operator is needed only for backward compatibility and
82 * in principle should not exit.
83 */
84 operator CLHEP::Hep3Vector () const { return CLHEP::Hep3Vector(x(),y(),z()); }
85
86 // -----------------------------
87 // General arithmetic operations
88 // -----------------------------
89
90 /**
91 * Assignment. */
92 BasicVector3D<T> & operator= (const BasicVector3D<T> & v) {
93 v_[0] = v.v_[0]; v_[1] = v.v_[1]; v_[2] = v.v_[2]; return *this;
94 }
95 /**
96 * Addition. */
97 BasicVector3D<T> & operator+=(const BasicVector3D<T> & v) {
98 v_[0] += v.v_[0]; v_[1] += v.v_[1]; v_[2] += v.v_[2]; return *this;
99 }
100 /**
101 * Subtraction. */
102 BasicVector3D<T> & operator-=(const BasicVector3D<T> & v) {
103 v_[0] -= v.v_[0]; v_[1] -= v.v_[1]; v_[2] -= v.v_[2]; return *this;
104 }
105 /**
106 * Multiplication by scalar. */
107 BasicVector3D<T> & operator*=(double a) {
108 v_[0] *= a; v_[1] *= a; v_[2] *= a; return *this;
109 }
110 /**
111 * Division by scalar. */
112 BasicVector3D<T> & operator/=(double a) {
113 v_[0] /= a; v_[1] /= a; v_[2] /= a; return *this;
114 }
115
116 // ------------
117 // Subscripting
118 // ------------
119
120 /**
121 * Gets components by index. */
122 T operator()(int i) const { return v_[i]; }
123 /**
124 * Gets components by index. */
125 T operator[](int i) const { return v_[i]; }
126
127 /**
128 * Sets components by index. */
129 T & operator()(int i) { return v_[i]; }
130 /**
131 * Sets components by index. */
132 T & operator[](int i) { return v_[i]; }
133
134 // ------------------------------------
135 // Cartesian coordinate system: x, y, z
136 // ------------------------------------
137
138 /**
139 * Gets x-component in cartesian coordinate system. */
140 T x() const { return v_[0]; }
141 /**
142 * Gets y-component in cartesian coordinate system. */
143 T y() const { return v_[1]; }
144 /**
145 * Gets z-component in cartesian coordinate system. */
146 T z() const { return v_[2]; }
147
148 /**
149 * Sets x-component in cartesian coordinate system. */
150 void setX(T a) { v_[0] = a; }
151 /**
152 * Sets y-component in cartesian coordinate system. */
153 void setY(T a) { v_[1] = a; }
154 /**
155 * Sets z-component in cartesian coordinate system. */
156 void setZ(T a) { v_[2] = a; }
157
158 /**
159 * Sets components in cartesian coordinate system. */
160 void set(T x1, T y1, T z1) { v_[0] = x1; v_[1] = y1; v_[2] = z1; }
161
162 // ------------------------------------------
163 // Cylindrical coordinate system: rho, phi, z
164 // ------------------------------------------
165
166 /**
167 * Gets transverse component squared. */
168 T perp2() const { return x()*x()+y()*y(); }
169 /**
170 * Gets transverse component. */
171 T perp() const { return std::sqrt(perp2()); }
172 /**
173 * Gets rho-component in cylindrical coordinate system */
174 T rho() const { return perp(); }
175
176 /**
177 * Sets transverse component keeping phi and z constant. */
178 void setPerp(T rh) {
179 T factor = perp();
180 if (factor > 0) {
181 factor = rh/factor; v_[0] *= factor; v_[1] *= factor;
182 }
183 }
184
185 // ------------------------------------------
186 // Spherical coordinate system: r, phi, theta
187 // ------------------------------------------
188
189 /**
190 * Gets magnitude squared of the vector. */
191 T mag2() const { return x()*x()+y()*y()+z()*z(); }
192 /**
193 * Gets magnitude of the vector. */
194 T mag() const { return std::sqrt(mag2()); }
195 /**
196 * Gets r-component in spherical coordinate system */
197 T r() const { return mag(); }
198 /**
199 * Gets azimuth angle. */
200 T phi() const {
201 return x() == 0 && y() == 0 ? 0 : std::atan2(y(),x());
202 }
203 /**
204 * Gets polar angle. */
205 T theta() const {
206 return x() == 0 && y() == 0 && z() == 0 ? 0 : std::atan2(perp(),z());
207 }
208 /**
209 * Gets cosine of polar angle. */
210 T cosTheta() const { T ma = mag(); return ma == 0 ? 1 : z()/ma; }
211
212 /**
213 * Gets r-component in spherical coordinate system */
214 T getR() const { return r(); }
215 /**
216 * Gets phi-component in spherical coordinate system */
217 T getPhi() const { return phi(); }
218 /**
219 * Gets theta-component in spherical coordinate system */
220 T getTheta() const { return theta(); }
221
222 /**
223 * Sets magnitude. */
224 void setMag(T ma) {
225 T factor = mag();
226 if (factor > 0) {
227 factor = ma/factor; v_[0] *= factor; v_[1] *= factor; v_[2] *= factor;
228 }
229 }
230 /**
231 * Sets r-component in spherical coordinate system. */
232 void setR(T ma) { setMag(ma); }
233 /**
234 * Sets phi-component in spherical coordinate system. */
235 void setPhi(T ph) { T xy = perp(); setX(xy*std::cos(ph)); setY(xy*std::sin(ph)); }
236 /**
237 * Sets theta-component in spherical coordinate system. */
238 void setTheta(T th) {
239 T ma = mag();
240 T ph = phi();
241 set(ma*std::sin(th)*std::cos(ph), ma*std::sin(th)*std::sin(ph), ma*std::cos(th));
242 }
243
244 // ---------------
245 // Pseudo rapidity
246 // ---------------
247
248 /**
249 * Gets pseudo-rapidity: -ln(tan(theta/2)) */
250 T pseudoRapidity() const;
251 /**
252 * Gets pseudo-rapidity. */
253 T eta() const { return pseudoRapidity(); }
254 /**
255 * Gets pseudo-rapidity. */
256 T getEta() const { return pseudoRapidity(); }
257
258 /**
259 * Sets pseudo-rapidity, keeping magnitude and phi fixed. */
260 void setEta(T a);
261
262 // -------------------
263 // Combine two vectors
264 // -------------------
265
266 /**
267 * Scalar product. */
268 T dot(const BasicVector3D<T> & v) const {
269 return x()*v.x()+y()*v.y()+z()*v.z();
270 }
271
272 /**
273 * Vector product. */
274 BasicVector3D<T> cross(const BasicVector3D<T> & v) const {
275 return BasicVector3D<T>(y()*v.z()-v.y()*z(),
276 z()*v.x()-v.z()*x(),
277 x()*v.y()-v.x()*y());
278 }
279
280 /**
281 * Returns transverse component w.r.t. given axis squared. */
282 T perp2(const BasicVector3D<T> & v) const {
283 T tot = v.mag2(), s = dot(v);
284 return tot > 0 ? mag2()-s*s/tot : mag2();
285 }
286
287 /**
288 * Returns transverse component w.r.t. given axis. */
289 T perp(const BasicVector3D<T> & v) const {
290 return std::sqrt(perp2(v));
291 }
292
293 /**
294 * Returns angle w.r.t. another vector. */
295 T angle(const BasicVector3D<T> & v) const;
296
297 // ---------------
298 // Related vectors
299 // ---------------
300
301 /**
302 * Returns unit vector parallel to this. */
303 BasicVector3D<T> unit() const {
304 T len = mag();
305 return (len > 0) ?
306 BasicVector3D<T>(x()/len, y()/len, z()/len) : BasicVector3D<T>();
307 }
308
309 /**
310 * Returns orthogonal vector. */
311 BasicVector3D<T> orthogonal() const {
312 T dx = x() < 0 ? -x() : x();
313 T dy = y() < 0 ? -y() : y();
314 T dz = z() < 0 ? -z() : z();
315 if (dx < dy) {
316 return dx < dz ?
317 BasicVector3D<T>(0,z(),-y()) : BasicVector3D<T>(y(),-x(),0);
318 }else{
319 return dy < dz ?
320 BasicVector3D<T>(-z(),0,x()) : BasicVector3D<T>(y(),-x(),0);
321 }
322 }
323
324 // ---------
325 // Rotations
326 // ---------
327
328 /**
329 * Rotates around x-axis. */
330 BasicVector3D<T> & rotateX(T a);
331 /**
332 * Rotates around y-axis. */
333 BasicVector3D<T> & rotateY(T a);
334 /**
335 * Rotates around z-axis. */
336 BasicVector3D<T> & rotateZ(T a);
337 /**
338 * Rotates around the axis specified by another vector. */
339 BasicVector3D<T> & rotate(T a, const BasicVector3D<T> & v);
340 };
341
342 /*************************************************************************
343 * *
344 * Non-member functions for BasicVector3D<float> *
345 * *
346 *************************************************************************/
347
348 /**
349 * Output to stream.
350 * @relates BasicVector3D
351 */
352 std::ostream &
353 operator<<(std::ostream &, const BasicVector3D<float> &);
354
355 /**
356 * Input from stream.
357 * @relates BasicVector3D
358 */
359 std::istream &
360 operator>>(std::istream &, BasicVector3D<float> &);
361
362 /**
363 * Unary plus.
364 * @relates BasicVector3D
365 */
366 inline BasicVector3D<float>
367 operator+(const BasicVector3D<float> & v) { return v; }
368
369 /**
370 * Addition of two vectors.
371 * @relates BasicVector3D
372 */
373 inline BasicVector3D<float>
374 operator+(const BasicVector3D<float> & a, const BasicVector3D<float> & b) {
375 return BasicVector3D<float>(a.x()+b.x(), a.y()+b.y(), a.z()+b.z());
376 }
377
378 /**
379 * Unary minus.
380 * @relates BasicVector3D
381 */
382 inline BasicVector3D<float>
383 operator-(const BasicVector3D<float> & v) {
384 return BasicVector3D<float>(-v.x(), -v.y(), -v.z());
385 }
386
387 /**
388 * Subtraction of two vectors.
389 * @relates BasicVector3D
390 */
391 inline BasicVector3D<float>
392 operator-(const BasicVector3D<float> & a, const BasicVector3D<float> & b) {
393 return BasicVector3D<float>(a.x()-b.x(), a.y()-b.y(), a.z()-b.z());
394 }
395
396 /**
397 * Multiplication vector by scalar.
398 * @relates BasicVector3D
399 */
400 inline BasicVector3D<float>
401 operator*(const BasicVector3D<float> & v, double a) {
402 return BasicVector3D<float>(v.x()*static_cast<float>(a), v.y()*static_cast<float>(a), v.z()*static_cast<float>(a));
403 }
404
405 /**
406 * Scalar product of two vectors.
407 * @relates BasicVector3D
408 */
409 inline float
410 operator*(const BasicVector3D<float> & a, const BasicVector3D<float> & b) {
411 return a.dot(b);
412 }
413
414 /**
415 * Multiplication scalar by vector.
416 * @relates BasicVector3D
417 */
418 inline BasicVector3D<float>
419 operator*(double a, const BasicVector3D<float> & v) {
420 return BasicVector3D<float>(static_cast<float>(a)*v.x(), static_cast<float>(a)*v.y(), static_cast<float>(a)*v.z());
421 }
422
423 /**
424 * Division vector by scalar.
425 * @relates BasicVector3D
426 */
427 inline BasicVector3D<float>
428 operator/(const BasicVector3D<float> & v, double a) {
429 return BasicVector3D<float>(v.x()/static_cast<float>(a), v.y()/static_cast<float>(a), v.z()/static_cast<float>(a));
430 }
431
432 /**
433 * Comparison of two vectors for equality.
434 * @relates BasicVector3D
435 */
436 inline bool
437 operator==(const BasicVector3D<float> & a, const BasicVector3D<float> & b) {
438 return (a.x()==b.x() && a.y()==b.y() && a.z()==b.z());
439 }
440
441 /**
442 * Comparison of two vectors for inequality.
443 * @relates BasicVector3D
444 */
445 inline bool
446 operator!=(const BasicVector3D<float> & a, const BasicVector3D<float> & b) {
447 return (a.x()!=b.x() || a.y()!=b.y() || a.z()!=b.z());
448 }
449
450 /*************************************************************************
451 * *
452 * Non-member functions for BasicVector3D<double> *
453 * *
454 *************************************************************************/
455
456 /**
457 * Output to stream.
458 * @relates BasicVector3D
459 */
460 std::ostream &
461 operator<<(std::ostream &, const BasicVector3D<double> &);
462
463 /**
464 * Input from stream.
465 * @relates BasicVector3D
466 */
467 std::istream &
468 operator>>(std::istream &, BasicVector3D<double> &);
469
470 /**
471 * Unary plus.
472 * @relates BasicVector3D
473 */
474 inline BasicVector3D<double>
475 operator+(const BasicVector3D<double> & v) { return v; }
476
477 /**
478 * Addition of two vectors.
479 * @relates BasicVector3D
480 */
481 inline BasicVector3D<double>
482 operator+(const BasicVector3D<double> & a,const BasicVector3D<double> & b) {
483 return BasicVector3D<double>(a.x()+b.x(), a.y()+b.y(), a.z()+b.z());
484 }
485
486 /**
487 * Unary minus.
488 * @relates BasicVector3D
489 */
490 inline BasicVector3D<double>
491 operator-(const BasicVector3D<double> & v) {
492 return BasicVector3D<double>(-v.x(), -v.y(), -v.z());
493 }
494
495 /**
496 * Subtraction of two vectors.
497 * @relates BasicVector3D
498 */
499 inline BasicVector3D<double>
500 operator-(const BasicVector3D<double> & a,const BasicVector3D<double> & b) {
501 return BasicVector3D<double>(a.x()-b.x(), a.y()-b.y(), a.z()-b.z());
502 }
503
504 /**
505 * Multiplication vector by scalar.
506 * @relates BasicVector3D
507 */
508 inline BasicVector3D<double>
509 operator*(const BasicVector3D<double> & v, double a) {
510 return BasicVector3D<double>(v.x()*a, v.y()*a, v.z()*a);
511 }
512
513 /**
514 * Scalar product of two vectors.
515 * @relates BasicVector3D
516 */
517 inline double
518 operator*(const BasicVector3D<double> & a,const BasicVector3D<double> & b) {
519 return a.dot(b);
520 }
521
522 /**
523 * Multiplication scalar by vector.
524 * @relates BasicVector3D
525 */
526 inline BasicVector3D<double>
527 operator*(double a, const BasicVector3D<double> & v) {
528 return BasicVector3D<double>(a*v.x(), a*v.y(), a*v.z());
529 }
530
531 /**
532 * Division vector by scalar.
533 * @relates BasicVector3D
534 */
535 inline BasicVector3D<double>
536 operator/(const BasicVector3D<double> & v, double a) {
537 return BasicVector3D<double>(v.x()/a, v.y()/a, v.z()/a);
538 }
539
540 /**
541 * Comparison of two vectors for equality.
542 * @relates BasicVector3D
543 */
544 inline bool
545 operator==(const BasicVector3D<double> & a, const BasicVector3D<double> & b)
546 {
547 return (a.x()==b.x() && a.y()==b.y() && a.z()==b.z());
548 }
549
550 /**
551 * Comparison of two vectors for inequality.
552 * @relates BasicVector3D
553 */
554 inline bool
555 operator!=(const BasicVector3D<double> & a, const BasicVector3D<double> & b)
556 {
557 return (a.x()!=b.x() || a.y()!=b.y() || a.z()!=b.z());
558 }
559} /* namespace HepGeom */
560
561#endif /* BASIC_VECTOR3D_H */
